PyNWN Class Library¶

2da¶

class pynwn.twoda.TwoDA(io)¶

2da Files.

expload(out_dir='.')¶

Extracts each line from a tlk and creates a yaml file.

get(row, col)¶

Gets a 2da entry by row and column label or column index.

get_column_index(col)¶

Gets the column index from a column label.

get_float(row, col)¶

Gets a 2da entry by row and column label or column index as a float.

get_int(row, col)¶

Gets a 2da entry by row and column label or column index as an int.

label_valid(lbl)¶

Deterimnes if a 2da label is valid.

parse(io)¶

Parses a 2da file.

parse_row(row, strip_row_number=True)¶

Parses a 2da row. Currently this is implimented by using the Python shlex package which parses a superset of 2da row format. So it could parse things that are not legal 2da rows.

set(row, col, val)¶

Sets a 2da entry by row and column label or column index. The value passed is automatically coerced to str.

Bif¶

The Key class abstracts over Bif classes, so there would never be any reason to instantiate this class directly.

class pynwn.key.Bif(key, io)¶

A Bif object encapsulates an open file handle pointing to a .bif file. It’s contents are indexed on first access, not on creation by NWN::Key::Key (to speed up things).

has_res(id)¶

Determine if Bif contains a resource by an resoure ID.

Parameters:id (int) – A resource ID.

Erf¶

class pynwn.erf.Erf(io=None)¶

Reads/Writes NWN ERF formats: erf, hak, and mod.

static filename_length(version)¶

Determine maximum ResRef length.

Parameters:version – ERF version. Only “V1.0” and “V1.1” are valid parameters.
static from_io(io)¶

Create an Erf from a file handle.

Parameters:io – A file handle.
write_to(io)¶

Writes ERF file to file handle.

Parameters:io – A file handle.

Gff¶

class pynwn.gff.Gff(filetype, filename)¶

Represents a GFF file.

build_fields(structure)¶

Build a field list from the specified structure.

build_struct(sid)¶

Builds a structural representation of the specified struct id.

dump()¶

Returns a string representation of the gff structure.

dump_struct(reference, indent)¶

Dumps a specific struct in the gff structure.

getstructure()¶

Gets the structure, loading it if necessary.

load()¶

Loads the source of the associated gff file.

parse_cexolocstring(offset)¶

Parses a gff cexolocstring.

parse_cexostring(offset)¶

Parses a gff cexostring.

parse_list(offset)¶

Parses a gff list.

parse_resref(offset)¶

Parses a gff resref.

parse_struct(offset)¶

Parses a gff struct.

parse_void(offset)¶

Parses a gff void.

save()¶

Saves the current version of the gff structure to the associated file.

scan(offset, length)¶

Scans the specified length from the specified offset in the open file, then returns to the previous position.

structure¶

The GFF structure.

write_cexolocstring(data)¶

Writes the specified data as a cexolocstring and returns it.

write_cexostring(data)¶

Writes the specified data as a cexostring and returns it.

write_resref(data)¶

Writes the specified data as a resref and returns it.

write_void(data)¶

Writes the specified data as a void and returns it.

Key¶

class pynwn.key.Key(io, data_path)¶

...

Parameters:
  • io – File handle.
  • data_path – Path to your NWN installation directory. e.g: C:/NeverwinterNights/NWN/

Tlk¶

class pynwn.tlk.Tlk(io=None)¶

Loads a TLK file from a file handle.

add(text, sound='', sound_length=0.0, volume_variance=0, pitch_variance=0)¶

Adds TLK entry to the end of entry list.

extract(start=0, count=None)¶

Extracts lines from a TLK, returning a new Tlk instance.

highest()¶

Determines the highest TLK entry.

inject(loc, tlk, start=0, count=None)¶

Injects lines from one TLK into another.
